_metadata.source: CIRRUS-HCM Phase 2 Poster, CVCT Forum Dec 2025

asset.name: EDG-7500
asset.one_liner: First-in-class cardiac sarcomere modulator for HCM that slows acto-myosin engagement without inactivating myosin, avoiding the LVEF reductions seen with cardiac myosin inhibitors

target.name: Cardiac Sarcomere (Acto-Myosin)
target.pathway: Acto-myosin cross-bridge cycling → cardiac contraction → hypercontractility in HCM

biology.simple_explanation: EDG-7500 is a novel cardiac sarcomere modulator designed to slow the rate of acto-myosin engagement and speed disengagement WITHOUT inactivating the myosin motor head. This is fundamentally different from cardiac myosin inhibitors (CMIs) which stabilize the super-relaxed state by inactivating myosin.

mechanism_detail.acto_myosin_engagement: Slows the rate of engagement in early systole
mechanism_detail.myosin_motor_head: Does NOT inactivate - preserves cardiac myosin function
mechanism_detail.result: Improved ventricular filling without compromising systolic function

vs_cmi.cmi_mechanism: Stabilize super-relaxed (SRX) state by inactivating myosin, decreasing myosin-actin cross-bridge formation
vs_cmi.cmi_problem: Might cause systolic dysfunction and require careful LVEF monitoring through frequent echocardiographic evaluation
vs_cmi.edg7500_advantage: No meaningful reductions in LVEF observed across the development program - potentially could eliminate the need for safety echocardiograms

why_good_target.clinical_validation: Sarcomere modulation validated by mavacamten (CAMZYOS) and aficamten in oHCM
why_good_target.preclinical_evidence: In preclinical studies and Phase 2 single-dose oHCM study, EDG-7500 demonstrated significant reductions in LVOT-G and NT-proBNP along with improvements in diastolic function
unmet_need: CMIs cause systolic dysfunction requiring frequent echo monitoring
Mavacamten requires REMS with echos every 4-12 weeks

clinical_data.full_title: A Multiple-Dose Phase 2 Study of Safety, Tolerability, and Effects on Hemodynamics and Functional Capacity of the Novel Cardiac Sarcomere Modulator EDG-7500 in Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy

institutions.name: University of California, San Francisco CA
Northwell Health, New Hyde Park NY
The Christ Hospital Health Network, Cincinnati OH
Virginia Mason Franciscan Health, Seattle WA

ohcm.definition: Obstructive HCM - thickened heart muscle blocks blood flow out through LVOT

nhcm.definition: Nonobstructive HCM - thickened muscle without significant outflow blockage

study_populations.ohcm: Obstructive HCM - thickened heart muscle blocks blood flow out of the heart through the LVOT
study_populations.nhcm: Non-obstructive HCM - thickened heart muscle without significant outflow blockage
study_populations.key_observation: Groups are reasonably well-matched except for expected obstruction differences (LVOT-G), ensuring treatment effects aren't due to baseline imbalances

demographics.age_sex_bmi: Basic patient characteristics - both groups mostly female, similar BMI ~27-28 kg/m2
demographics.pathogenic_sarcomere_variant: Confirmed genetic mutation causing disease - 24-33% have identified mutations; remainder may be polygenic or unidentified

cardiac_history.af_flutter: Atrial fibrillation/flutter history - irregular heartbeat increasing stroke risk
cardiac_history.icd: Implantable cardioverter-defibrillator - device for dangerous arrhythmias. Notably HIGHER in nHCM (50% vs 12%) reflecting higher arrhythmia risk despite no obstruction
cardiac_history.prior_srt: Prior septal reduction therapy - surgical myectomy or alcohol ablation

nyha_class.definition: New York Heart Association functional classification
nyha_class.class_ii: Slight limitation - comfortable at rest but ordinary activity causes symptoms
nyha_class.class_iii: Marked limitation - comfortable at rest but less than ordinary activity causes symptoms
nyha_class.study_finding: 59% NYHA II and 35% NYHA III in oHCM; 50%/50% split in nHCM - moderate to severe symptoms

lvef.definition: Left ventricular ejection fraction - percentage of blood pumped out each heartbeat
lvef.study_values: 65% oHCM, 61% nHCM - both NORMAL, typical for HCM (systolic function preserved)
lvef.key_relevance: EDG-7500's differentiator is maintaining LVEF vs CMIs which can reduce it

lvot_g.definition: Left ventricular outflow tract gradient - pressure difference showing obstruction
lvot_g.ohcm_threshold: ≥30 mmHg rest or ≥50 mmHg with provocation
lvot_g.interpretation: Confirms proper oHCM vs nHCM classification

e_prime.definition: Early diastolic mitral annular velocity - measures how well heart RELAXES (diastolic function)
e_prime.key_relevance: Key treatment target - EDG-7500 improves e' within 1 week

max_lv_wall_thickness.definition: Maximum thickness of left ventricular wall
max_lv_wall_thickness.study_values: 18 mm both groups - confirms HCM diagnosis

lavi.definition: Left atrial volume index - LA size adjusted for body size
lavi.study_values: 37 ml/m2 oHCM, 31 ml/m2 nHCM - mild enlargement in oHCM
lavi.relevance: LA enlargement reflects chronic elevated filling pressures and predicts AF risk

kccq.definition: Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire - patient-reported QoL

nt_probnp.definition: N-terminal pro-B-type natriuretic peptide - blood marker of cardiac wall stress
nt_probnp.study_values: 710-715 pg/mL median - ELEVATED indicating significant cardiac strain
nt_probnp.relevance: 56% achieved normalization (<150 pg/mL) at 100mg; strong correlation with pVO2 improvement

key_baseline_observations.icd_difference: 50% ICD rate in nHCM vs 12% in oHCM suggests nHCM patients may have higher arrhythmia burden despite lacking obstruction
key_baseline_observations.similar_symptoms: Both groups have similar NYHA class distribution and QoL impairment, supporting need for treatment in BOTH populations
key_baseline_observations.diastolic_dysfunction: Impaired e' in both groups (6-7 cm/s vs normal >8) confirms diastolic dysfunction is common target regardless of obstruction status

lvot_gradient.baseline_note: 5 participants had either resting gradients <30 mmHg or Valsalva gradients <50 mmHg on Day 1

resting_lvot_g.endpoint: % Reaching Resting LVOT-G <30 mmHg at Week 4

valsalva_lvot_g.endpoint: % Reaching Valsalva LVOT-G <50 mmHg at Week 4

lvot_gradient.complete_response_definition: Resting and Valsalva gradients <30 mmHg and <50 mmHg, respectively

nt_probnp.correlation_note: Improvements in NT-proBNP have shown a strong correlation to improvements in pVO2
nt_probnp.reference: Coats CJ et al., Eur Heart J 2024 Nov 8;45(42)

e_prime_diastolic_function.key_finding: Rapid dose-responsive improvements in mean e' observed as early as 1 week after initiation of treatment with EDG-7500
e_prime_diastolic_function.data_presentation: Mean ± SD for baseline value; Mean ± SEM for % change from baseline

kccq.section_title: KCCQ-OSS and KCCQ-CSS 4 Weeks vs. Baseline
kccq.p_values: p = NS at both doses across both KCCQ measures at Week 4

nyha_class.note: * Represents 7 individuals evaluated for NYHA at week 4 (50mg); * Represents patients evaluated by NYHA at week 2 (100mg)

nt_probnp.key_finding: EDG-7500 treatment resulted in rapid and robust reductions in NT-proBNP in participants with nHCM

e_prime_diastolic_function.key_finding: Treatment with EDG-7500 led to mean e' changes in participants with nHCM as early as one week following initiation of dosing
e_prime_diastolic_function.data_presentation: Mean ± SD for baseline value; Mean ± SEM for % change from baseline

kccq.section_title: KCCQ-CSS 50mg and 100mg after 4 Weeks vs. Baseline

50mg_dose_group.note: 4/8 at baseline; 1/8 not evaluated at baseline and/or EOS (end of study)

lvef_findings.main_finding: No Meaningful Reductions in LVEF or LVEF<50% Across a Broad Exposure Range Observed After EDG-7500 Treatment

pooled_analysis.description: Pooled Healthy Volunteer and CIRRUS Data
pooled_analysis.result: No correlation between EDG-7500 plasma concentration (ng/mL) and LVEF change from baseline

nhcm_low_baseline_lvef.finding: 4/12 (33%) participants with nHCM had a baseline LVEF <60% by core lab
nhcm_low_baseline_lvef.outcome: All 4 remained stable throughout the treatment period

treatment_emergent_adverse_events.note: Treatment-emergent adverse events in >1 participant in the combined oHCM and nHCM cohorts

events.note: mostly mild and transient in duration

atrial_fibrillation_detail.total: 4 participants (3 oHCM, 1 nHCM) had new onset symptomatic atrial fibrillation
atrial_fibrillation_detail.saes: Two of these events were considered SAEs
atrial_fibrillation_detail.lvef_note: None of the patients who had atrial fibrillation experienced LVEF <50% at any time

discontinuation.detail: One oHCM participant discontinued treatment due to moderate dizziness

from_poster: EDG-7500 has the potential to emerge as an exciting new therapeutic option for both oHCM and nHCM
EDG-7500 treatment appears to be generally well tolerated across a broad exposure range without meaningful impact on LVEF
Treatment with EDG-7500 was shown to improve LVOT-G, NT-proBNP, e', KCCQ, and NYHA
In the longer-term cohort of CIRRUS-HCM, intra-patient dose optimization is being explored

hcm_overview.definition: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is characterized by enhanced cardiac actin-myosin cross-bridge cycling, leading to hypercontractility, myocardial hypertrophy, fibrosis, and diastolic dysfunction
hcm_overview.prevalence: Most common inherited cardiac condition; ~1 in 500 people

ohcm_phenotype.definition: Obstructive HCM - combination of hypercontractility, hypertrophy, small LV cavity, and abnormal mitral valve apparatus leading to LVOT obstruction
ohcm_phenotype.pathophysiology: LVOT gradient ≥30 mmHg at rest or ≥50 mmHg with provocation

nhcm_phenotype.definition: Nonobstructive HCM - ventricular hypertrophy without significant LVOT obstruction

first_line.mechanism: Decrease calcium entry, reduce heart rate, prolong diastolic filling
first_line.limitations: No RCT evidence; do not modify disease

second_line.limitations: No RCT evidence; do not modify disease

cardiac_myosin_inhibitors.class_overview: First drug class targeting underlying HCM pathophysiology
cardiac_myosin_inhibitors.mechanism: Inhibit cardiac myosin ATPase to stabilize super-relaxed state

mavacamten.safety_concern: LVEF <50% in up to 13.8%; requires REMS with frequent echos

cardiac_myosin_inhibitors.edg7500_differentiation: No meaningful LVEF reductions - may eliminate need for safety echocardiograms

catalysts.event: Longer-term CIRRUS-HCM data with intra-patient dose optimization
catalysts.what_to_watch: Durability of efficacy; continued LVEF safety; optimal dosing strategy
Trial design for oHCM and/or nHCM populations; endpoints; comparator

competitors.limitation: REMS required; LVEF <50% up to 13.8%; $89,500/year; oHCM only
LVEF <50% in 5.3%; oHCM only; will require monitoring

our_advantages: No meaningful LVEF reductions - may eliminate need for REMS/frequent echos
Active in BOTH oHCM AND nHCM (nHCM has 400K US patients with zero approved therapies)

bull_case: No LVEF reductions - eliminates major CMI safety liability; may not need REMS/frequent echos
Only therapy targeting nHCM (400K US patients with ZERO approved options)
89% LVOT-G response at 100mg; 56% achieved NT-proBNP normalization
78% had ≥1 NYHA class improvement at 100mg - strong symptomatic benefit
Differentiated mechanism preserves myosin function vs CMIs that inactivate myosin
Rapid diastolic improvement within 1 week differentiates from competitors
bear_case: Small Phase 2 (N=29) - safety advantage needs larger trial confirmation
Atrial fibrillation in 13.8% (4/29, 2 SAEs) higher than expected
Commercial execution risk as emerging company
investment_analysis.probability_of_success: De-risked by Phase 2 but larger trials needed

market_opportunity.unmet_need: nHCM has NO approved therapies; oHCM therapies have significant monitoring burden
